alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Jackson; Williamson (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 30 at 6:41PM CDT until June 30 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: The National Weather Service in Paducah has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Williamson County in southern Illinois... Northeastern Jackson County in southern Illinois... Southwestern Franklin County in south central Illinois... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 641 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hurst, or 7 miles northwest of Herrin, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Herrin, West Frankfort, Benton, Carterville, Johnston City, Christopher, Zeigler, Cambria, Royalton, Energy, Hurst, West City, Buckner, Orient, Freeman Spur, Bush, Whiteash and Colp. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
